3: The target's memory data is located at the seventh end, named Shakespeare.
I analyzed the relevant information on the way. The memory doesn't seem to have much to do with the Moe Army.

2: Then he should be a bit more normal...

3: O visitors from afar against all odds, what are you here for?
The integrity test has passed. Corruption status unclear. A little more testing time is needed...
Boring! Too boring!
It's not how you're supposed to answer me! It should be like this—
Ah... the prisoner trapped in the white tower by fate...
We've come here from the wasteland of seeking, only to get a message from you...
Through the bitter and chaotic crowd as well as the thorny path, we knock your long-locked door...
This is how your answer is supposed to be.
What is that? How come I don't understand a word he's saying?
Are you fighting to get these guys recycled?
Don't just deny the meaning of our battles.
What a dull girl. You know nothing about the power of words.
Hmph, boring. Since you're valuable enough to be recycled, you should at least have basic combat abilities, right?
Then cut the crap and let's have a duel!
Duel... what a heart-pounding word!
A fight where both sides bet on their glory, oaths, and lives...
...all of which shine in a moment.
Is the recycling mission over yet? If the terminal is damaged at this time...
Karenina, that's Bianca calling.
Huh? What's up again... What? Go back immediately?
But I haven't had a fight with Lucia yet!
Does it have to be me? I've got no choice...
There's an urgent mission that requires my help. Anyway, I gotta go... Hmph, Lucia got lucky this time!
She's exactly the same as Bianca said...
The words are so powerful that a dispute is resolved just like this. Rudeness, brutalities, and senseless fights...
... all turned into ashes here and now.
Miss Bianca that's far away is indeed an excellent strategist.
The test passed and the data was complete. No sign of Punishing Virus corruption was detected.
I'll recycle the memory now.
